ratan
  • Jul 4, 2016

    the smudged notebook

    well, i’m sure that each one of us at some point of time has regretted smudging the first few pages of a prized notebook because our thoughts are too befuddled to develop into choicest words on paper. as the first entry commences a journey into the unknown, the remorse of muddling it lingers until the first milestone is reached or even longer.

  • Jul 2, 2016

    a name for xenia

    xenia is a concept of empathy in greek mythology. i named my daughter thus so that she grows up to be a compassionate woman.

  • Jul 2, 2016

    on writing

    each one of us is born with the ability to appreciate art; some of us just have this ability more pronounced than others. well, writing is an art form that needs no formal training to start, appreciate and master. we’ve an innate ability to tell stories, writing’s just putting these stories into words.
